purpose: Quantify deviation between framework outputs and traditional legal review

accessibility.democratization_benefit: Enables IT practitioners to perform initial screening

consistency.legal_review: Variable based on reviewer experience and interpretation

scalability.benefit: Can assess multiple vendors in parallel

findings.implication: Higher clause counts generally correlate with higher risk scores

key_findings.finding_1: Framework risk scores show good alignment with legal benchmarks
key_findings.finding_2: Clause detection rates deviate by 29.5% from legal benchmarks
key_findings.finding_3: Category-level analysis shows strongest alignment in pricing_terms and service_level categories
key_findings.finding_4: Framework provides 99.98% time reduction compared to manual legal review
key_findings.finding_5: 100% cost reduction for initial contract screening

limitations.benchmark_source: Legal benchmarks derived from published literature, not direct expert review
limitations.scope: Limited to SaaS/cloud contracts from major vendors

recommendations.recommendation_1: Framework suitable for initial screening and vendor comparison
recommendations.recommendation_2: Traditional legal review still recommended for high-value contracts (>$500K)
recommendations.recommendation_3: Framework outputs can inform and accelerate subsequent legal review
recommendations.recommendation_4: Combined approach: Framework for screening, legal review for finalization
